SA40-d-07-22-90-SOO.Narrative: ON JULY 22, 1990, AT 10:00 PM, TRAIN 288 WITH ENGINES UP 9386-UP 6213 AND SOO 6054, WITH 0 LOADS, 109 EMPTIES AND 3270 TONS, EMPTY COAL TRAIN, WHILE TRAVELING WESAT AT 40 MPH THROUGH THE TOWN OF AINSWORTH, IA AT MP 249.9 STRUCK AN MCI PASSENGER BUS BROADSIDE ON THE FIRST STREET CROSSING ON EAST ENDOF TOWN. BUS WAS UNOCCUPIED EXCEPT FOR THE DRIVER, WHO WAS FATALLY INJURED. THE CROSSING SIGNALS WERE FLASHING, ENGINE WHISTLE WAS BLOWING AND BELL RINGING, AND ENGINE HEADLIGHT WAS ON BRIGHT. IOWA COACHES BUS NO. 74 HAD JUST LET 30 PASSENGERS OFF IN THE TOWN OF AINSWORTH AND WAS DEPARTING TOWN AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT. TRAIN 288'S CREW FIRST OBSERVED THE BUS AS IT STARTED OVER FIRST STREET CROSSING MOVING SOUTH AT 1-2 MPH. AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION WAS INITIATED WHEN THE TRAIN WAS APPROXIMATELY 300 FEET FROM THE POINT OF IMPACT. THE REAR TEN FEET OF THE BUS WAS STRUCK BY THE TRAIN ANDTHE BUS WAS THROWN TOWARDS THE SW, STRIKING CROSSING SIGNAL RELAY CASE.THE DRIVER , NOT WEARING A SEAT BELT, WAS THROWN FROM THE VEHICLE, SUSTAINING INSTANT FATAL INJURY.NoneNoneNoneNone

SA30-d-07-31-90-SOO.Narrative: ON JULY 31, 1990, AT 1:10 AM ,WITC FREIGHT TRAIN 106 EAST, WITH ENGINE WICT 901-106, 25 LOADS, FIVEEMPTIES AND 3000 TONS, TRAVELING EASTWARD AT 25 MPH, USING SOO LINE TRACKAGE RIGHTS ON THE FOX LAKESUB, WAS ENTERING THE INTERLOCKING LIMITS AT RONDOUT, IL, MP 32.5, WHEN TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.THE CREW FOUND FOUR LOADED CARS OF CORN DERAILED,WITH ONE CAR ON ITS SIDE. THE CARS WERE PTLX 17873, 21ST CAR FROM HEADEND, ON SIDE ; CRDX 7170, 22ND CAR, UPRIGHT; PLCX12613, 23RD CAR, UPRIGHT; AND PLCX25549, 24TH CAR UPRIGHT. THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO CONTENTS OF UPRIGHT CARS. WEATHER CONDITIONS WERE DARK, CLEAR, DRY AND 60 DEGREES. THE TRACK WAS LAST INSPECTED BY TRACK FOREMAN AND TRACK INSPECTOR ONJULY 30, 1990. ON THAT DATE FOREMAN NOTED AND SURFACED LOW APPROACH WEST OF BRIDGE A-318. THE SURFACE CORRECTIONS WERE EXCESSIVE, ALLOWING A DEVIATION OF TWO-INCHES IN 20 FEET IN THE SUPER ELEVAGTIONOF THE CURVE. THIS DEVIATION RESULTED IN A WHEEL LIFT AT CRITICAL ROCKING SPEED. TRACK FOREMAN WASGIVEN A LETTER OF REPRIMAND.NoneNoneNoneNone

90072601-d-07-26-90-DRWY.Contributing Accident Cause: Other brake components damaged, worn, broken, or disconnected
90072601-d-07-26-90-DRWY.Narrative: 7/26/90 AT 6:44 PM, FOUR CARS WERE AT THE AIRLAWN SWITCH BACK. THE FIRST TWO CARS HAD BEEN MOVED THROUGH THE SWITCH BACK AND THE THIRD CAR BEING MOVED THRU THE SWITCH BACK WHEN THE FOURTH CAR BEGAN TOMOVE. (B) THE FOURTH CAR (A TANKCAR) ROLLED THRU FOUR GRADE CROSSING AND THRU PASSING SIDING (C), HITTING TWO GONDOLAS AND WAS RUPTURED BY IMPACT, CONTINUING DOWN THE (D) TRACK TO BELT JUNCTION DERAIL AT THE INTERCHANGE. THE GONDOALS DERAILED, STOPPING THE TANKCAR WHICH REMAINED ON THE RAILS. THE CAUSTIC SODA FROM THE RUPTURED TANKCAR WAS TRASLOADED TO OTHER TANKCARS. FIRE DEPT. ESTIMATED APPROXIMATELY 100 GALLONS OF THE CONTENTS WERE LOST. CREW MEMBERS WERE SENT TO DENVER GENERAL HOSPITAL FORALCOHOL & DRUG TESTING AT ABOUT 11:00 PM BUT HOSPITAL WOULD NOT TEST. CREW WAS SENT TO HOLLY CLINICTHE NEXT MORNING (FRIDAY) WHERE TESTS WERE PERFORMED. THERE WERE NO INJURIES OF FATALITIES.APPROXIMATELY 40 WORKERS FROM NEARBY BUSINESSES WERE EVACUATED AS A PRECAUTION.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

THE INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE TREE FELL DUE TO NATURAL CAUSES AND WAS NOT THE RESULT OF VANDALISM. THE FIREMAN SUSTAINED A NON-REPORTABLE INJURY WHEN HEJUMPED FROM THE CAB SEAT TO AVOID MORE SERIOUS INJURIES DUE TO THE IMPACT. SEVERAL ATTEMPS WERE MADETO OBTAIN AN INCIDENT NUMBER FROM THE D&H BUT DUE TO THEIR IMPENDING TAKE OVER BY THE CANADIAN PACIFIC SOURCES WERE UNABLE TO SUPPLY THE REQUIRED INFORMATION.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

NA43-d-07-20-90-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
NA43-d-07-20-90-SOO.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
NA43-d-07-20-90-SOO.Narrative: FREIGHT TRAIN 602 WITH LOCOMOTIVES 20025-2011 AND 40 LOADS, ONE EMPTY 5230 TONS WAS HEADING EASTBOUND AT MP 117.0 INTO THE MASON CITY YARD WHEN EIGHT LOADS OF CORN DERAILED, BL OCKING THE MAIN TRACK.THE DERAILED CARS WERE 26TH THROUGH 33RD FROM THE HEAD END. WHILE FIVE OF THE LOADS OF CORN REMAINEDUPRIGHT, THREE CARS ENDED UP ON THEIR SIDES AND HAD TO HAVE THEIR LADING VACULATED. UPON INVESTIGATION IT WAS DETEERMINED THAT AS THE TRAIN WAAS 150 FEET FROM THE JUNCTION SWITCH FROM THE AUSTIN MAINLINE TO MASON CITY MAIN LINE, THE 28TH HEAD CAR DERAILED ON WIDE TRACK GAUGE. WHEN THE CAR HIT THEFROG TO THE MASON CITY MAIN LINE SWITCH, THE CAR TIPPED OVER, CAUSING THE 27TH AND 29TH CARS TO ALSOTIP OVER ON THEIR SIDES. THE REMAINDER OF THE DERAILED CARS REMAINED UPRIGHT. THERE WERE NO ROAD CROSSINGS BLOCKED BY THE DERAILMENT. THE TRACK CONDITION IN THE AREA WAS POOR. THE GROUND WAS MUDDY AROUND THE DERAILMENT SITE DUE TO FOUR INCHES OF RAIN THAT HAD FALLEN 12 HOURS PRIOR TO THE MISHAP. THERE WAS STANDING WATER BETWEEN THE TIES, AND THE WET CONDITION PREVENTED THE TIES FROM HOLDING SPIKES.NoneNoneNone

NA44-d-07-28-90-SOO.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 0655 HOURS ON SATURDAY, JULY 28, 1990, TRAIN #213 WITH LEAD UNIT 6004 AND TWO OTHERUNITS IN CONSIST WITH 39 LOADS AND ONEEMPTY, 2683 TONS DERAILED THE NINTH, TENTH AND ELEVENTH HEADCARS AS THE TRAIN TRAVERSED THE WYE SWITCH LEADING TOWARD THE NEW INTERMODAL FACILITY AT SHOREHAM, MN. THE LEAD WHEEL OF NINTH HEAD CAR TTWX 993605 CLIMBED THE SWITCH POINT BECAUSE OF LV FORCES RESULTING FROM IRREGULAR TRACK ALIGHTMENT, CROSSED THE TOP OF THE POINT AND DROPPED BETWEEN THE POINT ANDTHE STOCK RAIL, CAUSING THE P OINT TO GAP OPEN. THE TENTH HEAD CAR FOLLOWED THROUGH THE OPEN POINT AND WAS COMPLETELY DERAILED. THE ELEVENTH HEAD CAR DERAILED ONLY ONE SET OF TRUCKS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

NA42-d-07-12-90-SOO.Accident Cause: Other coupler and draft system defects, (CAR) (Provide detailed description in narrative)
NA42-d-07-12-90-SOO.Narrative: ON A WARM AFTERNOON FREIGHT TRAIN 230 WITH ENGINE CONSIST 776-6614-6405-756 WITH 75 LOADS, 12 EMPTIES, 9601 TONS WAS MOVING EASTBOUND AT MP 44.8 NEAR FT ATKINSON, IA. THE TRAIN WAS IN THE PROCESS OF STOPPING AT THE CALMER DEPOT DUE TO NEEDING A TRACK WARRANT. THE TRAIN HAD SLOWED TO ABOUT 2MPH WITHTHE THROTTLE IN #2 POSITION, BRAKE VALVE SET TO FIRST SERVICE, WHEN THE AIR BRAKES WENT INTO EMERGENCY. THE CREW NOTED THAT THE TELEMETRY DEVICE ON THE REAR CABOOSE (DRGW 1504) DID NOT REGISTER ANY AIR, HOWEVER THE MOVEMENT LIGHT INDICATED THAT THE CABOOSE WAS MOVING AND IT COULD BE HEADING DOWN HILL TOWARDS HIM. THE CRANE OINFORM HIM THAT THE CABOOSE INDICATED IT WAS MOVING AND IT COULD BE HEPERATOR STOPPED HIS UNIT AND OPENED THE KNUCKLE TO ALLOW HIM TO CATCH THE RUNAWAY CABOOSE. HE THEN REVERSED THE LOCOMOTIVE CRANE AND STARTED WESTBOUND, WHEN CABOOSE DRGW 1504 CAME AROUND THE CURVE AT 40MPH ANDCOLLIDED WITH THE IDLER CAR SOO 5207 WHICH WAS ATTACHED TO THE EAST END OF THE CRANE. INVESTIGATION SHOWED THAT THE REAR EMPTY HOPPER HAD ABROKEN KNUCKLE THROWER ON THE "A" END OF THE CAR.NoneNoneNoneNone

NA39-d-07-01-90-SOO.Narrative: ON A HOT SUMMER AFTERNOON FREIGHT TRAIN 230-01 WITH UNITS 757-756-2036-4601-2045 AND 77 LOADS, 4 EMPTIES, 9660 TONS WAS HEADING EASTBOUND AT10 MPH AT MP 82.7 NEAR CHARLES CITY, IA WHEN FIVE COVERED HOPPERS LOADED WITH CORN DERAILED. THE ENGINEER STATED THAT HE FELT A JERK IN THETRAIN AND THE AIR WENT INTO EMERGENCY. AFTER STOPPING, THE CREW INSPECTED THE TRAIN AND FOUND THE 65TH THROUGH 69TH CARSFROM THE HEAD END ALL LAYING ON THEIR SIDES. SOO 84776 WAS LAYING ON IT'S SIDE TO THE NORTH, WHILE S00 88380, 74035, MILW 378, AND MILW 1286 WERE LAYING TO THE SOUTH. IN ADDITION, GNWR 301315 WHICH WAS NOT DERAILED, DID NOT SUN A BENT CORNER POST. THE MAIN LINE WAS BLOCKED AND SUSTAINED SEVERE DAMAGE FOR ABOUT 360 FEET. THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS UNDER A 10 MPH RESTRICTION BY TRACK BULLETIN AND HAS BEEN WORKED BY TIE GANG WORKING IN THAT AREA. THE TIE GANG WAS WORKING BETWEEN MP 82.0 AND MP 83.8, AND THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED AT MP 82.7. CAUSE OF DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO HAVE BEEN MISSING ANCHORS AND SOME TIES NOT SPIKED. THIS COUPLED WITH 86 DEGREES & HEAVILY LOADED TRAIN, CAUSED TRACK TO BUCKLE.NoneNoneNone

REA900718-d-07-18-90-ACWR.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
REA900718-d-07-18-90-ACWR.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
REA900718-d-07-18-90-ACWR.Narrative: NORTHBOUND FROM MP34.7, THE TRACK ASCENDS AN ABRUPT SHORT GRADE OF .75 PERCENT AND STRAIGHTENS-OUT FROM A LONG 2 DEGREE RIGHT-HAND CURVE. SOUTHBOUND FROM MP34.7, THE TRACK ASCENDS AN ABRUPT SHORT GRADE OF .90 PERCENT AND ENTERS A LONG 2 DEGREE LEFT-HAND CURVE. THESE CIRCUMSTANCES OBVIOUSLY PLACE MP34.7 AT OR NEAR THE BOTTOM OF A "SNAG" OR "DIP". ON JULY 18TH, 1990 AS ACWR ANGINES 5886-5820 PULLING16 LOADED COVERED HOPPERS AND 3 EMPTY GONDOLAS APPROACHED MP 34.7 NORTHBOUND, THE ENTIRE TRAIN WASDESCENDING THE .9 PERCENT GRADE WITH SPEED BEING CONTROLLED BY THE "STRETCH" OR "POWER BRAKING" METHOD. AS THE LOCOMOTIVES APPROACHED THE POINT AT WHICH THE TRACK BEGINS TO RISE ON THE .75 PERCENT GRADE NORTHBOUND, THE ENGINEER RELEASED AN AUTOMATIC BRAKE APPLICTION OF 14 LBS. THE THROTTLE WAS NOT ADVANCED BUT REMAINED IN THE NO.2 POSITION AT APPROXIMATELY 10 MPH UNTIL WELL AFTER A FULL RELEASE OFBRAKE CYLINDER PRESSURE HAD OCCURRED ON THE 19 CARS. A RELEASE OF TRAIN BRAKES, WITH OR WITHOUT POWER APPLIED FOR STRETCHING AT THIS LOCATION WILL RESULT IN A RAPID BUILD-UP OF SPEED.NoneNoneNoneNone

SA31-d-07-31-90-SOO.Maintenance Railroad Name: Chicago And North Western Railway Company
SA31-d-07-31-90-SOO.Narrative: ON JULY 31, 1990, AT 9:35 PM, BENSENVILLE YARD ASSIGNMENT 1303 WITH ENGINES 1549-1540, WITH 14 LOADS, 8 EMPTIES AND 1700 TONS, TRAVELING WEST AT 15 MPH WHILE DELIVERING CARS TO THE CNW AT BRYN MAWR, DERAILED FIVE CARS ON CROSSOVER NO. 3 ON THE CNW. BOTH MAIN TRACKS AND CNW WERE BLOCKED. FMGR 13107 ROCKED OFF DUE TO EXCESSIVE SIDE BEARING CLEARANCE OF ONE AND ONE FOURTH INCHES. THE CAR RODE THE TOPOF THE RAIL FOR A DISTANCE OF 12 FEET, WHEEL THEN DERAILED TO THE WEST. THE CAR WAS THEN DRAGGED FOR A DISTANCE OF 1.3 MILES TO THE DERAILMENT SITE.
